repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: makes insertion points behave as they do elsewhere, adds the ability to track indentation (which I don't use here, but which I think will clear things up)

comment_data.body:
I'd reverse this. It seems simpler to check if anything was written to the stream itself, rather than testing all of its children first.
Also, I think the child condition needed to be negated, so I changed it to `all()` below.
```suggestion
        if self.stream.tell():
            return False
        return all(child.empty() for child in self.prepended_children)
```
(For the loop variable name change, it provides more information right away when reading the line from left to right. Otherwise, I'd have to wait unto the very end to understand that we're traversing the children here.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,11 @@ def __init__(self, stream=None):
         self.write = stream.write
         self.markers = []
 
+    def empty(self):
+        if any(x.empty() for x in self.prepended_children):
+            return False
+        return not self.stream.tell()

comment_data.body: Hmm. *Is* this a `PyxCodeWriter`, or should it just be *using* one?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -81,40 +81,37 @@ def visit_Node(self, node):
         return node
 
 
-class TemplateCode(object):
+class TemplateCode(PyxCodeWriter):

comment_data.body:
Somewhere in between maybe?

I refactored it to just use one, which I think works fine
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -81,40 +81,37 @@ def visit_Node(self, node):
         return node
 
 
-class TemplateCode(object):
+class TemplateCode(PyxCodeWriter):

@@ -82,39 +82,50 @@ def visit_Node(self, node):
 
 
 class TemplateCode(object):
+    """
+    Adds the ability to keep track of placeholder argument names to PyxCodeWriter.
+
+    Also adds extra_stats which are nodes bundled at the end when this
+    is converted to a tree.
+    """
     _placeholder_count = 0
 
-    def __init__(self):
-        self.code_lines = []
-        self.placeholders = {}
-        self.extra_stats = []
+    def __init__(self, writer = None, placeholders = None, extra_stats=None):

comment_data.body: Doesn't this duplicate the `extra_stats` if both try to append them in the end?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,14 +136,22 @@ def _new_placeholder_name(self, field_names):
 
     def generate_tree(self, level='c_class'):
         stat_list_node = TreeFragment(
-            "\n".join(self.code_lines),
+            self.writer.getvalue(),
             level=level,
             pipeline=[NormalizeTree(None)],
         ).substitute(self.placeholders)
 
         stat_list_node.stats += self.extra_stats
         return stat_list_node
 
+    def insertion_point(self):
+        new_writer = self.writer.insertion_point()
+        return TemplateCode(
+            writer=new_writer,
+            placeholders=self.placeholders,
+            extra_stats=self.extra_stats

comment_data.body:
I think we can avoid the overhead of a generator expression here.
```suggestion
        return all([child.empty() for child in self.prepended_children]) if self.prepended_children else True
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,11 @@ def __init__(self, stream=None):
         self.write = stream.write
         self.markers = []
 
+    def empty(self):
+        if self.stream.tell():
+            return False
+        return all(child.empty() for child in self.prepended_children)

comment_data.body: You can declare this as a `cpdef` method in the pxd file.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,11 @@ def __init__(self, stream=None):
         self.write = stream.write
         self.markers = []
 
+    def empty(self):

comment_data.body: I don't think so, because `generate_tree` is only called on the top-level `TemplateCode` (unless I'm missing something, which is definitely possible)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,14 +136,22 @@ def _new_placeholder_name(self, field_names):
 
     def generate_tree(self, level='c_class'):
         stat_list_node = TreeFragment(
-            "\n".join(self.code_lines),
+            self.writer.getvalue(),
             level=level,
             pipeline=[NormalizeTree(None)],
         ).substitute(self.placeholders)
 
         stat_list_node.stats += self.extra_stats
         return stat_list_node
 
+    def insertion_point(self):
+        new_writer = self.writer.insertion_point()
+        return TemplateCode(
+            writer=new_writer,
+            placeholders=self.placeholders,
+            extra_stats=self.extra_stats

commit.message:
Use PyxCodeWriter in the dataclass TemplateCode

makes insertion points behave as they do elsewhere,
adds the ability to track indentation (which I don't use
here, but which I think will clear things up)

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Use PyxCodeWriter in the dataclass TemplateCode
